intro: Gibasis venustula subsp. peninsulae, commonly known as the Peninsula beauty bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or wetland habitats. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, clustered blooms during the late spring to early summer. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting pollinators.
